column4: is there any way to get details on which files are being processed when copying in nautilus?
usually it displays that info as it copies (file operations)
I thought so too, but all I see is "copying 2,500 files (in "Some Folder") to "Some Other Folder"
it should so the progress as it copies (at least it does in mine)
there is no dropdown.  it will show another window that says file operations...and will show the progress of the copy...
yeah, I see the progress "2.0 GB of 20.0 GB --- approximately 90 hours left (59.3 KB/sec)" but no listing of which file is being processed
that's pretty slow, what are you copying from to?
a hard drive with some bad blocks... it's excruciatingly slow
that's why I was hoping to see which files it's getting stuck on
is it windows or linux?  have you run fsck?
i think dd does that, but not sure.
dd doesn't support error retry... only error skipping
i think testdisk -- gosh don;t remember
i'd use that with extreme caution though
looks like testdisk doesn't support copying on a file/directory level... it's more of a "recover deleted files" solution
yeah it is more a file recovery tool.  but I hadn't seen it in years...
